2e2a81df-60cf-456e-8c2d-6f0b10b6b63f.description: Earners of the COVID-19: Workplace Safety badge have proven to have current knowledge about the SARS-CoV-2 virus and its associated disease COVID-19. They can identify safety protocols for maintaining health and safety returning to work in the office and in clients' homes and communicate this information clearly.
2e2a81df-60cf-456e-8c2d-6f0b10b6b63f.name: COVID-19: Workplace Safety

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Discuss basic information about SARS-CoV-2 and COVID-19
Describe common symptoms of COVID-19
Explain how COVID-19 is spread
Discuss why COVID-19 can be particularly dangerous for clients
Explain simple measures that can be taken to enhance safety in the workplace
Identify appropriate Personal Protective Equipment and recognize when it should be used
Explain why physical distancing measures are important when working
Discuss safety protocols that might apply in different situations
Differentiate between clear and unclear communication between workers that may impact safety
Recognize the importance of clear communication with clients

73f20c35-5459-46e9-b3ec-99ca65a08295.description: Earners of the Building Science Principles badge have proven to have knowledge of building science and house as a system thinking.
73f20c35-5459-46e9-b3ec-99ca65a08295.name: Building Science Principles

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: Building Performance Institute Building Science Principles Certification
alignments.description: Building Science Principles is your first step into energy efficient home performance. You will learn how building science demonstrates the ways in which various components of a home interact to affect the home’s overall performance. Understanding those relationships between various systems of the home will enable you to assist yourself and others.

badge_template_activities.title: Recognize common construction details of a house
Explain how a house is an interconnected system
Define mechanisms of heat transfer and how they relate to a house
Explain why insulation and air sealing are important and describe common methods of each
Describe the importance of moisture control
Identify common mechanical systems and their properties
Explain conservation strategies related to home performance
Successfully pass all quizzes in the course, including the final quiz

0d0c4473-093d-4826-9670-0f9f2287ba61.description: Earners of the Retrofit Installer Technician badge have proven to have knowledge of retrofit measures for improving a home's building performance for energy efficiency and health and safety.
0d0c4473-093d-4826-9670-0f9f2287ba61.name: Retrofit Installer Technician - Online

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Standard Work Specifications
alignments.description: Created by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory, the Standard Work Specifications detail the proper installation of energy efficiency retrofits in residential single family, manufactured housing, and multifamily housing.

badge_template_activities.title: Explain the job of a Retrofit Installer Technician in weatherization
Recall the importance of clear communication
Calculate some simple math problems
Describe health and safety protocols important to you and your client
Recall components of windows and doors
Choose appropriate air sealing and insulation materials
Recall how to install simple baseload measures in a home
Describe the process of duct-sealing
Explain why we use blower doors in weatherization and describe basic steps in blower door testing
Explain the importance of combustion safety testing

a23651cc-6bb3-4e72-b740-df3946285b53.description: Earners of the Crew Leader badge have proven to have knowledge in a wide variety of construction and weatherization tasks, as well as the skill and organization to coordinate a crew of retrofit installer technicians.
a23651cc-6bb3-4e72-b740-df3946285b53.name: Crew Leader Online

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Crew Leader Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: Job tasks for those pursuing a career in Crew Leader as outlined by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

badge_template_activities.title: Explain the role of the crew leader
Describe and model of clear communication
Discuss problem solving methods
Explain appropriate ways to teach adults and how to delegate
Identify and describe combustion safety testing, including testing steps and selecting protocols
Describe conditions needed, processes to have in place and steps for blower door depressurization testing, pressure pan readings, and zonal pressure diagnostics, including evaluation of results
Explain the importance and steps of effective air sealing
Discuss the importance of quality controls for a crew leader
Recall inventory and maintenance tasks that a crew leader needs to manage jobs
Locate Standard Work Specifications relevant to the work of a retrofit installer and crew leader
Successfully complete all online course content, submit all assignments and pass all quizzes

210fa2b0-5227-43f0-99f8-b49896b8b3ab.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate leadership skills in their interactions with fellow employees and with the people they supervise. They know how to build and contribute to high-functioning teams using enhanced communication skills.
210fa2b0-5227-43f0-99f8-b49896b8b3ab.name: Leadership Power Skills

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 6 workshops to learn and practice Leadership Power Skills in the workplace.
Practiced job-relevant leadership techniques in the workplace and reported on their experience to fellow participants.
Completed Communicating with Confidence workshop.
Completed Conflict Resolution for Leaders workshop.
Completed Time Management for Leaders workshop.
Completed Effective Delegation Techniques workshop.
Completed How to Deliver Coaching and Feedback workshop.
Completed Building a Culture of Accountability workshop.

8c9ce0c9-2399-453c-a326-cc1d2acd0bd6.description: Earners of the Energy Auditing Software badge have proven to have knowledge of and the ability to apply and use energy auditing software.
8c9ce0c9-2399-453c-a326-cc1d2acd0bd6.name: Energy Auditing Software

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Identify typical components found in many energy audit reports
Define an Energy Conservation Measure (ECM)
List work scope components
Identify the criteria for including energy conservation measures in an energy audit report
Select technical details found in the Weatherization Assistant software and reports
Create and upload audit input data and an audit report for both a ‘stick-built’ and manufactured home
Successfully pass all quizzes in the course, including submitting two final audits

9047c7a9-6c77-45c3-a089-4019051b0a3c.description: Earners of the Energy Auditor badge have proven to have knowledge in a wide-variety of construction and weatherization tasks with a focus on assessing a home's building performance for energy efficiency and healthy & safety.
9047c7a9-6c77-45c3-a089-4019051b0a3c.name: Energy Auditor - online

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Energy Auditor Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: Job tasks for those pursuing a career in Single-Family Energy Auditing as outlined by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

alignments.name: BPI Energy Auditor Certification Scheme
alignments.description: The Building Performance Institute's Energy Auditor Certification is both a standard and a requirement for those working as Energy Auditors in the weatherization industry.

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate ability to search pdf files and online building code resources
Identify health & safety considerations when conducting energy audits
Use building performance principles to assess construction basics
Describe the relationship between insulation and the types of heat flow
Name the drivers of air flow and the impact of air-sealing on building assemblies
Identify sources of moisture and the importance of moisture control and mitigation

Describe conditions needed, processes to have in place and steps for blower door depressurization testing, duct leakage testing, exhaust fan flow testing, pressure pan readings, zonal pressure diagnostics and infrared thermography, including evaluation of results
Assess mechanical systems, including heating, cooling, water heaters, efficiency and related venting, as well as building ventilation options
Evaluate HVAC system assessment and combustion safety videos
Upload an energy audit and related input form
Compare baseload and seasonal energy consumption
Estimate appliance energy use
Summarize the relationship between windows, doors and energy use
Calculate areas, volume, attic venting and roof pitch
Successfully complete all assignments and quizzes in online Energy Auditor course

a8d7a92c-44d9-4233-a149-3c597019dece.description: Earners of the Essentials of Healthy Homes badge have proven to have knowledge of the connections between housing and health, including the seven principles of healthy housing.
a8d7a92c-44d9-4233-a149-3c597019dece.name: Essentials of Healthy Homes

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Single-Family Energy Auditor Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: The NREL Energy Auditor JTAs guide training goals for those seeking careers in energy efficiency and home performance.

badge_template_activities.title: Describe the connection between housing and health
Recognize the key role people play interacting with their home
Realize that communication among people can be difficult
Explain the concept of house as a system
Describe the problems moisture in a home can cause to health
Explain why cleaning a home can affect someone’s health
Identify common pests and the importance of Integrated Pest Management
Outline ventilation strategies in the home and explain why they are needed
Describe common safety hazards in the home
Identify common contaminants in a home and their effect on health
Explain the connection between home maintenance and health
Successfully passed all coursework in the class and completed a healthy homes assessment of their own home

c5ac123d-e351-49de-ae49-418dc2a843fd.description: Earners of the Quality Control Inspector badge have proven to have knowledge and application of standards and requirements for inspecting energy retrofits in homes.
c5ac123d-e351-49de-ae49-418dc2a843fd.name: Quality Control Inspector

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Quality Control Inspector Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: Job tasks for those pursuing a career in Quality Control Inspectors as outlined by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

badge_template_activities.title: Verify worker compliance with safety regulations during retrofit
Evaluate in-process work quality of weatherization and energy retrofits
Verify on-site documentation, including permitting and reports, during weatherization and energy retrofits
Verify installed measures and initial energy assessment details after the completion of weatherization and retrofits

Evaluate installed measures for compliance with standards, including completing diagnostic testing on homes such as blower door depressurization, fan exhaust flow testing, worst case CAZ depressurization, and zonal pressure diagnostics
Confirm whether policy requirements have been satisfied to bring the energy retrofit project into compliance and file can be closed out
Interpret and apply related work standards and explain how to use them, including IRC, NFPA fire codes, OSHA, Lead RRP, ASHRAE 62.2, Energy Star (TM), NREL's SWS, and ANSI/BPI
Discuss and explain building science and the concepts behind 'House as a System' in applying them to inspections and occupant safety
Successfully passed all quizzes and assignments in the course.

cb282140-2add-418e-aa4c-4799c1a304e8.description: Earners of the Healthy Home Evaluator badge have proven to have knowledge and ability to assess home-based environmental health and safety hazards and provide a prioritized list of recommendations to address those hazards.
cb282140-2add-418e-aa4c-4799c1a304e8.name: Healthy Home Evaluator

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: BPI Healthy Home Evaluator Certification Scheme
alignments.description: The BPI Healthy Home Evaluator Certification Scheme handbook outlines skills and knowledge necessary to become a certified Healthy Homes Evaluator.

badge_template_activities.title: Explain the seven principles of healthy housing
Outline the importance of data collection, including taking an environmental history and qualitative and quantitative assessments
Describe at risk populations
Identify specific contaminants and environmental situations that contribute to poor health outcomes
Demonstrate how to use analytic tools to identify healthy housing issues and interpret results
Create a scope of work with recommendations based on a healthy housing analysis
Discuss the importance of clear communication and education for both clients and contractors
Identify the importance of personal safety, liability and insurance for the Healthy Home Evaluator

dd96d1dc-84e3-45b2-84ae-a1a019fbbace.description: Earners of the Microsoft Excel Basics badge demonstrate skills using Microsoft Excel to create worksheets and workbooks. They can enter and use data, formulas, cell references and format spreadsheets for decision making.
dd96d1dc-84e3-45b2-84ae-a1a019fbbace.name: Microsoft Excel Basics

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Microsoft Excel Basics Course including up to 12 hours of training and practice.
Design a basic worksheet, enter data, build formulas, and set up and print pages.
Build charts and graphs.
Format spreadsheets using stylistic tools.
Demonstrate ability to use conditional formatting. Demonstrate IF function analysis and implementation.
Demonstrate ability to use absolute and relative cell references.

4470aaef-8352-4f39-80c8-68b03ef1d17d.description: Earners of the Microsoft Excel Intermediate badge demonstrate skills using Microsoft Excel to create intermediate level worksheets and workbooks. They can arrange and calculate data across multiple worksheets and manage large tables of data for decision making.
4470aaef-8352-4f39-80c8-68b03ef1d17d.name: Microsoft Excel Intermediate

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Microsoft Excel Intermediate Course including up to 12 hours of training and practice.
Arrange and calculate data across multiple worksheets.
Demonstrate ability to work with the formula auditing toolbar including tracing precedents and dependents and inserting commands.
Creating, using and managing range names.
Demonstrate ability to manage large tables of data including filtering and sorting.
Calculate with dates.
Demonstrate understanding of order of precedence, absolute and relative cell references and using the show formulas tool.

8ed2a747-5c62-4e58-a82f-7bbffaee3372.description: Earners of the Thermal Bypass Checklist badge have shown the ability to successfully fill out the Thermal Bypass Checklist for the New Mexico Energy Conservation Code. This accreditation is sponsored by the New Mexico Energy, Minerals and Natural Resources Department and funded by the USDOE State Energy Department.
8ed2a747-5c62-4e58-a82f-7bbffaee3372.name: Thermal Bypass Checklist

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: New Mexico Residential Energy Conservation Code
alignments.description: The NM Residential Energy Conservation Code, which is 14.7.6 of the NM Administrative Code, allows for the use of a Thermal Bypass Inspection Checklist in the process of building permitting.

badge_template_activities.title: Discuss energy codes and the New Mexico codes
Explain the compliance pathways in the NMECC 2018 Residential Code
Explain basic principles of building science
Discuss Thermal Bypass and its importance
Describe and understand each item on the NM Thermal Bypass Inspection Checklist
Locate information and resources going forward

3b74d3c0-2dcb-493b-8171-b74ee6f38b63.description: Earners of the PROTEC Professional Readiness and Technical Experience for Careers have demonstrated professionalism in the work place and proficiency using computer office, presentation, and social media applications, excellent customer service, and teamwork.
3b74d3c0-2dcb-493b-8171-b74ee6f38b63.name: PROTEC

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 30 hours of online training
Demonstrate basic proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, Google Applications and Apple Applications
Demonstrate basic proficiency with Social Media applications
Demonstrate basic proficiency with Online Communication Tools

48365952-11fa-49f3-93f3-e1a613b0ca00.description: Earners of the Ergonomic Assessment for Office Workspaces Badge are able to recognize office workspace hazards and risk factors, collect information to assess risks and develop communication methods to prevent ergonomic illnesses and injuries.
48365952-11fa-49f3-93f3-e1a613b0ca00.name: Ergonomic Assessment for Office Workspaces

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Ergonomic Assessment for Office Workspaces two-day workshop
Describe the risk factors and body mechanics that cause ergonomic injuries
Identify  office ergonomic hazards
Demonstrate knowledge of the signs and symptoms of ergonomic illnesses and injuries
Collect initial assessment information to develop baseline risk and action levels
Communicate ergonomic principles to employees to prevent injuries and illnesses

a0b46f24-f399-4c81-ac44-0c7ab6ef7c75.description: Earners of the Building Operator Certification Level I Training Certificate of Completion have demonstrated competence in locating building equipment, distribution pathways, and control points; calculating facility energy consumption; critiquing HVAC systems operation; and identifying opportunities for energy and water use reduction, while maintaining occupant comfort.
a0b46f24-f399-4c81-ac44-0c7ab6ef7c75.name: BOC Level I Training Certificate of Completion

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: Building Operator Certification Level I
alignments.description: Building Operator Certification(R) (BOC) is the leading training and certification program for building engineers and maintenance personnel. The industry's longest-running energy efficiency training, it offers a fresh perspective on building management to save building owners and occupants money, and improve career outlooks for building operators.

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in 74 hours of classroom training, worth 7.4 IACET CEUs in building operation and maintenance
Has two or more years experience in building operation and maintenance, either via direct work experience or education, or some combination of the two
Identified the fundamentals of building systems, including the operation and maintenance of envelope, central heating, cooling, air and ventilation systems in buildings

Described how energy is used in commercial buildings and identified and prioritized conservation opportunities, including basic principles of energy accounting (benchmarking), evaluation of fuel options, operation and maintenance strategies to improve efficiency, and energy management planning techniques.

Evaluated types of lighting for economical and energy efficient lighting systems by exploring lighting levels, quality and maintenance, as well as lighting fixture and control technologies, common upgrades, retrofit and redesign options, and the management strategies as they apply to space use and function.

Described automatic control systems and equipment, particularly for central air systems, targeting possible inefficiencies in HVAC systems and evaluating potential problems as part of an enhanced operation and maintenance program.

Identified basic causes of indoor environmental quality problems and developed a method of diagnosis and solution, by exploring the dynamic components of IEQ in relation to source control, occupant sensitivity and ventilation, while emphasizing open communications with occupants and reliable investigation techniques.

Identified common opportunities offering the greatest energy savings potential in commercial buildings, as well as examining typical areas and problems associated with different system types, equipment, tools and techniques.

Determined water savings measures in their building through detection and repair of leaks, operational changes, and low-cost equipment improvements, including reviewing water/sewer bills and rainwater/irrigation management.
Attended PNM business energy efficiency program for utility rebate opportunities.
Successfully completed all assignments and course exams.

645e5300-0a8d-469d-914d-b73672f06645.description: Earners of the Building Analyst badge have proven to have knowledge in the basics of building construction and building science with a focus on assessing a home's performance for energy efficiency and health and safety.
645e5300-0a8d-469d-914d-b73672f06645.name: Building Analyst

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: BPI Building Analyst Testing Knowledge List
alignments.description: List of knowledge, skills and abilities of a Building Analyst as determined by the Building Performance Institute, a national certifying body for home performance professionals.

badge_template_activities.title: Recognize and explain building science terminology
Name and describe buildings and their systems
Use building performance principles to assess construction basics
Describe the relationship between insulation and the types of heat flow
Name the drivers of air flow and the impact of air-sealing on building assemblies
Identify sources of moisture and the importance of moisture control and mitigation
Describe conditions needed, processes to have in place and steps for blower door depressurization testing, exhaust fan flow testing, and pressure pan readings
Assess mechanical systems, including heating, cooling, water heaters, efficiency and related venting, as well as building ventilation options
Evaluate HVAC system assessment and combustion safety videos
Compare baseload and seasonal energy consumption
Describe and explain industry standards for home performance
Explain modeling and work scope as used in energy efficiency
Successfully complete all assignments and quizzes in online Building Analyst course

a8f291bd-03dd-4a73-a554-267c405505e8.description: Earners of the Introduction to Energy Efficiency and Weatherization badge have proven to have knowledge of measures appropriate for energy efficiency installers.

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Explain the importance of good communication skills and professionalism while at work
Identify important water conservation measures for homes
Describe the difference between regular and smart thermostats and explain the installation process
Describe the work of an energy efficiency / weatherization installer
Recall basic building science principles
Explain health and safety considerations for an Installer
Demonstrate basic math skills relevant to the Installer
Describe simple insulation, air sealing and window and door measures for the Installer and show the ability to select appropriate materials
Identify baseload measures that can improve energy efficiency in the home
Completed all course content and successfully passed all quizzes in the course

fd37da91-c7ca-4d52-b120-b991599ceabe.description: Earners of the Microsoft Word Intermediate badge demonstrate intermediate skills using Microsoft Word in a business environment completing documents like business letters, inter-office reports, contracts, memos and other business communications.
fd37da91-c7ca-4d52-b120-b991599ceabe.name: Microsoft Word Intermediate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Microsoft Word Intermediate course including up to 12 hours of training and practice.
Create documents using more advanced features for a business environment.
Demonstrate line and paragraph spacing.
Create borders.
Demonstrate ability to insert and size images.
Demonstrate ability to insert text boxes, tables and Word Art.
Demonstrate how to use margins, indents and custom tab stops.
Demonstrate using non-breaking hyphens and spaces.
Demonstrate how to create headers, footers, footnotes and endnotes.
Demonstrate how to create envelopes using mail merge.

be72f956-8ad8-401b-988c-845afac69d87.description: The President's Diversity Advisory Committee (hosted) a series called “Honoring Our Relationships Through Solidarity.” The series was over five meeting sessions that consisted of training and activities where participants identified systems of exclusion and oppression in higher education, explored the role of data in dismantling those systems and identified actionable visions of the future.
be72f956-8ad8-401b-988c-845afac69d87.name: PDAC Social Justice Series

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in all five trainings and workshops.
Identify systems of exclusion in higher education and SFCC’s role in perpetuating these systems.
Develop a framework that helps identify systems of exclusion and oppression.
Explore the role of data in dismantling systems of exclusion and oppression at SFCC.
Create a vision for SFCC's future without these systems of oppression and exclusion.

5e576169-637f-47a1-a16c-8717c7f81e52.description: Earners of the Customer Service Expert badge demonstrate ability to anticipate customer needs, solve problems, express customer appreciation and resolve service issues. Develop telephone, email, texting, online and written communication skills needed to master delivery of exceptional customer service. Show ability to listen to customers, diffuse difficult situations and find solutions to delight.
5e576169-637f-47a1-a16c-8717c7f81e52.name: Customer Service in an Online Environment

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Exceptional Customer Service lessons
Demonstrate clear and concise communication skills through role playing
Demonstrate successful conflict resolution
Demonstrate effective listening skills in order to satisfy customer needs
Compose written email response to answer customer complaint

8b8e5f5e-f357-47b7-9053-4bd57920244b.description: Earners of the Microsoft Word Basics badge demonstrate skills using Microsoft Word in a business environment completing documents like business letters, inter-office reports, contracts, memos and other business communications.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Microsoft Word Basics Course including up to 12 hours of training and practice.
Design a simple document with inserted objects. Create, edit, save and print documents.
Create footers, headers and page numbers. Format text and paragraphs. Perform cut, copy, and paste features.
Demonstrate ability to use Word's built-in templates and create customized template.
Demonstrate ability to use other customizing features of Word including: custom tables, non-breaking spaces, section breaks, and Smart Art.
Demonstrate ability to import data from Microsoft Excel and create and complete a mail merge.

67e5a3e6-835d-4a39-9439-d0ae6dd6940a.description: Earners of the Basic Combustion Testing badge have proven to have knowledge and skill to complete basic combustion testing, such as spillage and carbon monoxide testing on combustion appliances.

alignments.name: NREL Energy Auditor JTA
alignments.description: The National Renewable Energy Laboratory has developed the Energy Auditor Job Task Analysis to determine appropriate knowledge, skills and abilities of a professional energy auditor working in the building performance industry.

alignments.name: NREL Weatherization Crew Leader JTA
alignments.description: The National Renewable Energy Laboratory has developed the Weatherization Crew Leader Job Task Analysis to determine appropriate knowledge, skills and abilities of a weatherization crew leader working in the building performance industry.

badge_template_activities.title: Identify the different categories of heating and hot water system equipment and distinguishing characteristics of each type

List operational components and safety features of both heating and hot water systems
Use a gas leak detector as part of a combustion safety test
Set up combustion analysis tools and equipment
Correctly perform combustion safety tests for spillage and carbon monoxide on combustion appliances

28d3e29c-f98f-4a26-85a1-6b3c5c67799b.description: Earners of the Team Power badge are able to demonstrate 21st Century Skills of critical thinking, creative problem solving, innovating, collaborating and communicating effectively working in a team environment.

Communicate methods to expand potential ideas and evaluate possible solutions
Describe key components of team performance
Describe a work environment that promotes creativity, innovation and team work
Complete marketing team exercise

1ee48f90-dd88-4f2e-8ee4-ebaeeab888b6.description: Earners of the Basic Office Software Skills badge demonstrate the ability to operate software applications used in business including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Google applications and other software geared toward work situations.
1ee48f90-dd88-4f2e-8ee4-ebaeeab888b6.name: Basic Office Software Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint lessons
Demonstrate basic proficiency using Google Drive and Google platforms including sharing and collaborative editing of documents, storing photos, creating spreadsheets, and creating forms
Demonstrate basic proficiency using online communication and conferencing tools including Zoom, GoToMeeting, Webex, and Microsoft Teams

0188ada9-e55d-427f-b9d9-7234744272dd.description: Earners of the Basic Social Media badge demonstrate proficiency in using social media platforms for marketing and online promotions.

0f003570-b17c-4132-88b1-a53209348505.description: Earners of the Multifamily Quality Control Inspector badge have proven to have knowledge and skills in assessing multifamily buildings for energy-efficiency and performance.

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Multifamily Quality Control Inspector Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: Job tasks for those pursuing a career in Multifamily Quality Control Inspecting as outlined by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

badge_template_activities.title: Develop a Quality Control Plan for a typical multifamily retrofit project
Explain the purpose of each portion of a Quality Control Plan to peers, owners, residents, and contractors
Develop an appropriate field verification and diagnostic testing plan for a multifamily project
Implement a QC Plan for a multifamily project, including specifying remedial actions/processes

b542c812-d097-42b0-adb8-c213eb3b7a8b.description: Earners of the Air and Duct Sealing badge have shown the ability to complete home air and duct sealing to create an efficient ducting system and prepare for insulation.
b542c812-d097-42b0-adb8-c213eb3b7a8b.name: Air and Duct Sealing

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Standard Work Specifications
alignments.description: The Standard Work Specifications were developed by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory to guide energy efficient residential construction and retrofits in site-built, manufactured housing and multifamily homes.

badge_template_activities.title: Identify typical construction details that lead to gaps in pressure and thermal boundaries and know how to treat them
Describe the various tools and materials used in air-sealing and duct-sealing, including high-temperature applications
Select appropriate tools and materials to air-seal in a home
Use materials correctly to seal gaps in pressure boundary efficiently
Test (or observe testing) using pressure diagnostic equipment to evaluate the effectiveness of the air and duct sealing
Discuss post air-sealing and duct-sealing procedures

af6e0351-5ecd-44b3-8068-caae6bf1f874.description: Earners of the Algae Cultivation Intro to Microscopy badge will demonstrate basic handling and operation of microscopes in a lab setting including characterization of algae cultures; applying serial dilution procedure to cell counts with hemocytometer; use of hemocytometer to estimate cell concentration and to identify and enumerate algal culture contaminants.
af6e0351-5ecd-44b3-8068-caae6bf1f874.name: Algae Cultivation Intro to Microscopy

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Prerequisite: Complete ALTF 161- Introduction to Algae Cultivation online course at Santa Fe Community College (SFCC).
Demonstrate competency in microscope handling and operation.
Demonstrate competency in use of a microscope to identify basic algal cell types.
Demonstrate competency in use of a hemocytometer to estimate cell concentration.
Demonstrate competency in use of a microscope to identify and enumerate algal culture contaminants.
Demonstrate competency in applying serial dilution procedure to cell counts with hemocytometer.

ae012c82-1b3e-4c72-84f9-4d205f686e02.description: A digital badge that certifies the holder's ability to competently design for the specific parameters of 3D Printing.
ae012c82-1b3e-4c72-84f9-4d205f686e02.name: Design for 3D Printing

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Badge Earner used CAD software to design specifically for 3D Printing applications

f419f4a8-f3fe-4868-bcb4-b05791a1e754.description: Earners of the Infrared for Home Retrofits badge have proven to have knowledge of and the ability to use an infrared thermographic camera for home auditing and retrofits.

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Discuss the theory behind infrared thermographic cameras
Explain the benefits and limitations of infrared (IR) thermography for analyzing building performance
List keys to creating quality IR images for home diagnostics
Identify pros and cons of IR imaging from inside versus outside a home or other building
Visually identify air, water and insulation problems in a home via IR camera
Utilize IR imaging in conjunction with blower door to track infiltration and guide air sealing in homes

13a6bf8e-5213-4b98-b581-e7e36e1f5fe2.description: Earners of the NEAT Software badge have proven to have knowledge of and the ability to apply and use National Energy Audit Tool software.

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Identify required versus optional inputs in NEAT
Create and print a NEAT audit report
Identify inputs important to accurately model a site-built home
Calculate area-weighted R-values
Identify energy audit requirements/features as outlined in Section 2, General Requirements, and Section 5, Cost-Benefit Analysis in ANSI/BPI-1200-S-2015 and ANSI/BPI-1100-T-2014.

9003dbe8-197d-4283-b9b7-7eb7caef8d1e.description: Earners of the Advanced Retrofits: Smart Thermostats badge have proven to have knowledge and skills in assessing a home for smart thermostat installation and completing installation and set-up.

alignments.description: Job tasks for those pursuing a career in Single-Family Energy Auditing as outlined by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate correct installation and setup of smart thermostats in a variety of client and equipment situations
Communicate appropriately tailored information regarding the use of a smart thermostat based upon client preferences and experience
Assess the applicability of a smart thermostat as an energy-saving measure in an energy efficiency program based upon existing conditions

3e04e439-c0e1-4ee3-8901-2efeb5c7d1b3.description: Earners of the Algae Cultivation Basic Measurements and Lab Safety badge will demonstrate basic lab safety, basic equipment operations, calibration and measurements. Laboratory Safety includes use and proper choice of PPE, SDS, applications for the GHS system, and the NFPA 704 standard, and laboratory waste handling. Basic instrumentation includes: Calibration and measurements for pH, salinity, conductivity, temperature, and pipetting; chemical hood and autoclave operations.
3e04e439-c0e1-4ee3-8901-2efeb5c7d1b3.name: Algae Cultivation Basic Measurements and Safety

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Prerequisite: Complete ALTF 161- Introduction to Algae Cultivation online course at Santa Fe Community College (SFCC).
Demonstrate competency in proper lab etiquette and safety for algae cultivation.
Demonstrate competency in calibration and measurements for pH salinity, conductivity, temperature and use of analytical balance in a lab setting.
Demonstrate competency in Chemical hood and autoclave operations in a lab setting.
Demonstrate competency in pipetting in a lab setting.

529b4829-3d31-4e67-a48b-6e6b1df1ef27.description: Earners of the Energy Auditing Software badge have proven to have knowledge of and the ability to apply and use NEAT auditing software.
529b4829-3d31-4e67-a48b-6e6b1df1ef27.name: NEAT Audit Software

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Identify required versus optional inputs in NEAT
Create and print a NEAT audit report
Identify inputs important to accurately model a site-built home
Search NEAT User and Engineering Manuals
Calculate area-weighted R-values
Identify energy audit requirements/features as outlined in Section 2, General Requirements, and Section 5, Cost-Benefit Analysis in ANSI/BPI-1200-S-2015 and ANSI/BPI-1100-T-2014.

95443ee9-4afe-4c4c-9615-cbf10a7e36c4.description: This badge shows successful completion of the Certified Restaurant Water Auditor course. Earning this demonstrates that the badge-holder has the knowledge, skills, and abilities to assess the water usage and opportunities for water efficiency retrofits of commercial restaurants. The badge-holder has successfully passed the Certified Restaurant Water Auditor (CRWA) exam with a score of no less than 70% and a probationary audit under the supervision of a certified CRWA trainer.
95443ee9-4afe-4c4c-9615-cbf10a7e36c4.name: Certified Restaurant Water Auditor

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: Commercial Restaurant Water Audit

badge_template_activities.title: Identified various water-using appliances in commercial kitchens and restaurants, including steamers, combi-ovens, ice makers, dip wells, hot well tables, dishwashers, etc.

Measured water use of water fixtures in commercial restaurants, including faucets, toilets, water fountains, and various leaks and drips in order to calculate total water use and potential water savings opportunities.
Installed new aerators on faucets in order to reduce overall water use.
Identified water-cooled appliances in order to identify air-cooled replacement options to reduce water use.
Interviewed restaurant owner or manager to determine water demands of commercial restaurant.
Utilized various energy and water saving appliance tracker websites in order to determine potential replacement appliances.
Compiled comprehensive and well-informed water audit based on gathered data and research.

890301f9-53ef-4ae1-8363-9cb1b9e25c77.description: Earners of the Crew Leader Hawaii badge have proven to have knowledge in a wide variety of construction and weatherization tasks, as well as the skill and organization to coordinate a crew of retrofit installer technicians in Hawaii.

Describe your role as a crew leader
Model effective crew management
Explain how to create and read a work order
Describe how to maintain tools and equipment
Locate the Standard Work Specifications and explain their use
Describe crew and client safety in homes with natural or propane gas

ba0accce-d701-4a71-9946-a3171aee0692.description: Earners of the Energy Auditor Hawaii badge have proven to have knowledge of construction and weatherization tasks in Hawaii with a focus on assessing a home's building performance for energy efficiency and health and safety.

Recall basic building science principles
Describe in detail the information you need to include on the Priority List and other considerations
Evaluate a home
Enter collected data into the Audit form
Complete an Energy Audit report

badge_template_activities.title: Verify worker compliance with safety regulations during retrofit
Evaluate in-process work quality of weatherization and energy retrofits
Verify on-site documentation, including permitting and reports, during weatherization and energy retrofits
Verify installed measures and initial energy assessment details after the completion of weatherization and retrofits

Evaluate installed measures for compliance with standards, including completing diagnostic testing on homes such as blower door depressurization, fan exhaust flow testing, worst case CAZ depressurization, and zonal pressure diagnostics
Confirm whether policy requirements have been satisfied to bring the energy retrofit project into compliance and file can be closed out
Interpret and apply related work standards and explain how to use them, including IREC, NFPA fire codes, OSHA, Lead RRP, ASHRAE 62.2, Energy Star (TM), NREL's SWS, and ANSI/BPI
Discuss and explain building science and the concepts behind 'House as a System' in applying them to inspections and occupant safety
Successfully passed all quizzes and assignments in the course.

a5784e3e-168c-48c4-b1f1-0b7172b391f3.description: Earners of the Retrofit Installer Technician Hawaii badge have proven to have knowledge of retrofit measures for improving a home's building performance for energy efficiency and health and safety in Hawaii.

Recall the importance of clear communication
Calculate some simple math problems
Describe health and safety protocols important to you and your client
Recall components of windows and doors
Choose appropriate air sealing and insulation materials
Recall how to install simple baseload measures in a home
Explain how to change out shower heads and faucet aerators
Describe how to install a window air-conditioner
Explain how to install a timer on an electric water heater

90ad181e-9e72-41c5-a057-fd0cc4eb77b1.description: Earners of the Intermediate Combustion Testing badge have proven to have knowledge and skill to complete worst case combustion appliance zone depressurization testing.
90ad181e-9e72-41c5-a057-fd0cc4eb77b1.name: Intermediate Combustion Testing

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Energy Auditor JTA
alignments.description: The National Renewable Energy Laboratory has developed the Energy Auditor Job Task Analysis to determine appropriate knowledge, skills and abilities of a professional energy auditor working in the building performance industry.

alignments.name: NREL Weatherization Crew Leader JTA
alignments.description: The National Renewable Energy Laboratory has developed the Weatherization Crew Leader Job Task Analysis to determine appropriate knowledge, skills and abilities of a weatherization crew leader working in the building performance industry.

badge_template_activities.title: Correctly identify the combustion appliance zone (CAZ) in various houses
Demonstrate all steps required to measure worst case CAZ depressurization testing
Record worst case CAZ depressurization values with no errors
Compare CAZ depressurization results to pre-determined CAZ limits
Determine pass or fail of the CAZ depressurization with no errors
Discuss potential remedies to CAZ pressure failure(s)

d6b52455-d1e8-4f11-803f-67a19c631abb.description: Earners of the Algae Cultivation Culture Scale-up badge will perform techniques for algal culture scale-up including sanitizing culture vessels & transfer equipment; preparation of stock chemical solutions & bulk nutrient media; sterile transfer of algal culture from 10 ml test tube to 10 L; and from 10 L to 1,000 L.
d6b52455-d1e8-4f11-803f-67a19c631abb.name: Algae Cultivation Culture Scale-up

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the Introduction to Algae Cultivation online course, SFCC ALTF 161
Demonstrate competency in sanitizing culture vessels & transfer equipment in microfarm and laboratory settings.
Demonstrate competency in preparation of stock chemical solutions & bulk nutrient media in microfarm and laboratory settings.
Demonstrate competency in performing sterile transfer of algal culture from 10 ml test tube to 10 L in microfarm and laboratory settings.
Demonstrate competency in performing sterile transfer of algal culture from 10 L to 1,000 L in a microfarm setting.

66d19d52-0ca7-41fa-8f65-7725768b27be.description: Earners of the Algae Cultivation Productivity Measurements badge will demonstrate procedures for algal culture growth monitoring including Absorbance (Optical density) measurements; Dry weight; Ash-free dry weight; pigment extraction and TLC analysis. Data collected will be used to create a growth curve.
66d19d52-0ca7-41fa-8f65-7725768b27be.name: Algae Cultivation Productivity Measurements

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the Introduction to Algae Cultivation online course, SFCC ALTF 161
Demonstrate competency in performing Absorbance (Optical density) measurements for an algal sample in a laboratory setting.
Demonstrate competency in performing Dry weight and Ash-free Dry Weight measurements for an algal sample in a laboratory setting.
Apply data from algal sample monitoring techniques to create a growth curve.
Demonstrate competency in pigment extraction and TLC analysis.

ed5bc53d-a8db-424b-9d5e-d3b4734a2b7f.description: Earners of the Baseload Water - Showerhead & Aerator badge have proven to have the knowledge, skills, and abilities to install low-flow aerators and showerheads to reduce water and energy loads.
ed5bc53d-a8db-424b-9d5e-d3b4734a2b7f.name: Baseload Water - Showerhead & Aerator

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Standard Work Specifications
alignments.description: The Standard Work Specifications are best practice guidelines for contractors working in the energy efficiency and home performance field.

badge_template_activities.title: Remove existing high-waste water fixtures from property
Install low-flow faucet aerators and showerheads according to manufacturer instructions and applicable building codes
Select showerhead fixtures that are no more than 2.5 gallons per minute
Select faucet aerators that are no more than 2.0 gallons per minute
Verify that there is no water leakage upon completion
Verify that fixtures are undamaged
Verify, by testing, that fixtures are fully functional
Clean work area

d272e251-93ca-43cf-b283-c689a3a4e11b.description: Earners of the Crew Leader badge have proven to have knowledge in a wide variety of construction and weatherization tasks, as well as the skill and organization to coordinate a crew of retrofit installer technicians.
d272e251-93ca-43cf-b283-c689a3a4e11b.name: Crew Leader in-person

alignments.name: NREL Crew Leader Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: Job tasks for those pursuing a career in Crew Leader as outlined by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

badge_template_activities.title: Explain the role of the crew leader
Describe and model of clear communication
Discuss problem solving methods
Explain appropriate ways to teach adults and how to delegate
Identify and describe combustion safety testing, including testing steps and selecting protocols
Describe conditions needed, processes to have in place and steps for blower door depressurization testing, pressure pan readings, and zonal pressure diagnostics, including evaluation of results
Explain the importance and steps of effective air sealing
Discuss the importance of quality controls for a crew leader
Recall inventory and maintenance tasks that a crew leader needs to manage jobs
Locate Standard Work Specifications relevant to the work of a retrofit installer and crew leader
Successfully complete all online course content, submit all assignments and pass all quizzes

b77d258e-5adb-47ce-a795-8038c055436e.description: Earners of the Energy Auditor badge have proven to have knowledge in a wide-variety of construction and weatherization tasks with a focus on assessing a home's building performance for energy efficiency and healthy & safety.
b77d258e-5adb-47ce-a795-8038c055436e.name: Energy Auditor - in-person

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Energy Auditor Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: Job tasks for those pursuing a career in Single-Family Energy Auditing as outlined by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

alignments.name: BPI Energy Auditor Certification Scheme
alignments.description: The Building Performance Institute's Energy Auditor Certification is both a standard and a requirement for those working as Energy Auditors in the weatherization industry.

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate ability to search pdf files and online building code resources
Identify health & safety considerations when conducting energy audits
Use building performance principles to assess construction basics
Describe the relationship between insulation and the types of heat flow
Name the drivers of air flow and the impact of air-sealing on building assemblies
Identify sources of moisture and the importance of moisture control and mitigation

Describe conditions needed, processes to have in place and steps for blower door depressurization testing, duct leakage testing, exhaust fan flow testing, pressure pan readings, zonal pressure diagnostics and infrared thermography, including evaluation of results
Assess mechanical systems, including heating, cooling, water heaters, efficiency and related venting, as well as building ventilation options
Evaluate HVAC system assessment and combustion safety videos
Upload an energy audit and related input form
Compare baseload and seasonal energy consumption
Estimate appliance energy use
Summarize the relationship between windows, doors and energy use
Calculate areas, volume, attic venting and roof pitch
Successfully complete all quizzes and assessments in the Energy Auditor course

a5fd54bf-bacb-4060-aeed-db10d80cd212.description: Earners of the Exterior Door - Infiltration Reduction badge have proven to have the knowledge, skills, and abilities to weather strip and set sweep on an exterior door to reduce air infiltration while maintaining or improving the proper operation of the door.
a5fd54bf-bacb-4060-aeed-db10d80cd212.name: Exterior Door - Infiltration Reduction

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: Weatherization Crew Leader Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: In 2018, NREL's Crew Leader Scheme Committee agreed it was best practice for crew leaders to know how to do the tasks listed in the Retrofit Installer Technician (RIT) JTA before supervising RITs. Therefore, the RIT JTA has been eliminated as a stand-alone JTA, and its tasks inserted into the CL JTA.

badge_template_activities.title: Installed weather stripping and door sweep in a durable manner.
Prevented air infiltration when the door is closed as verified by blower door and smoke test.
Installation of weather stripping and door sweep did not impede door operation.
Adjusted door as required to properly fit the jamb and allow for ease of operation.

f93c889e-951c-4f3c-b997-2e33e534d956.description: Earners of the Algae Cultivation Culture Isolation & Maintenance badge will demonstrate procedures for algae culturing including selection and preparation of algal growth media, agar plates and slants; isolation and transfer techniques for algae cells and strains; culture maintenance; and the application of sterile techniques.

Demonstrate competency in preparation of agar plates and slants in a laboratory setting.
Demonstrate competency in isolation and transfer techniques for algae cells and strains in a laboratory setting.
Demonstrate competency in applying sterile technique in a laboratory setting.

d6a97358-fbca-4468-af32-f03f9b6538e7.description: Earners of the Algae Cultivation Data Collection & Record Keeping badge will perform techniques for maintaining a lab notebook; plotting, displaying and describing data, applying techniques to analyze and interpret data collected in microfarm and laboratory settings.

Demonstrate competency in maintaining a lab notebook in microfarm and laboratory settings.
Demonstrate competency in performing analysis and interpretation of data in microfarm and laboratory settings.

2ba110e2-e299-4922-b54c-9358eba5f5a3.description: This badge shows successful completion of the Certified QWEL Landscape Water Auditor course. Earning this demonstrates that the badge-holder has the knowledge, skills, and abilities to assess the water usage and opportunities for water efficiency retrofits of onsite irrigation systems.

Create a plant water use budget
Perform an onsite landscape water use assessment
Recommend actions to reduce onsite irrigation water use

Set irrigation controllers to water the landscape in an efficient and effective way
Keep QWEL certification valid

e4742122-300f-4d49-a7da-be85b9432bb4.description: Earners of the Air Leakage and Duct Testing Certificate badge have shown the ability to successfully complete required blower door and duct testing diagnostics for the New Mexico Energy Conservation Code. This certification is sponsored by the New Mexico Energy, Minerals and Natural Resources Department and funded by the USDOE State Energy Department.

alignments.description: The NM Residential Energy Conservation Code, which is 14.7.6 of the NM Administrative Code, requires air leakage and duct testing.

badge_template_activities.title: Discuss the New Mexico ECC 2018 residential code requirements for air leakage and duct testing
Explain simple building science concepts related to air leakage and duct testing
Calculate math equations related to air leakage and duct testing
Use a blower door for air leakage testing and create a report in compliance with the RESNET/ICC 380 standard
Use a duct tester for duct testing and create a report in compliance with NMECC requirements
Troubleshoot common issues related to air leakage and duct testing
Locate information to further inform yourself

4c756d1e-8d5c-413d-9aac-7dd50357edec.description: Earners of this badge successfully completed the Certified Hotel Water Auditor course. The badge-holder has demonstrated the knowledge, skills, and abilities to assess the water usage and opportunities for water efficiency retrofits of commercial lodging establishments. The badge-holder has successfully passed the Certified Hotel Water Auditor (CHWA) exam with a score of no less than 70% and a probationary audit under the supervision of a certified CHWA trainer.

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Passed and maintained Certified Restaurant Water Auditor (CRWA) certification.
Identified various water-using appliances in commercial hotels and motels, including ice makers, public restrooms, laundry facilities, cooling towers, etc.

Measured water use of water fixtures in commercial lodging establishments, including faucets, toilets, showers, and various leaks and drips in order to calculate total water use and potential water savings opportunities.
Installed new aerators on faucets in order to reduce overall water use.
Identified irrigation system efficiency improvements.
Interviewed owner or manager to determine water demands of commercial establishment.
Utilized various energy and water saving appliance tracker websites in order to determine potential replacement appliances.
Compiled comprehensive and well-informed water audit based on gathered data and research.

4573c885-00fc-44b6-8cfd-77db3c5ec6aa.description: Earners of the Cold Climate Air Source Heat Pump (ccASHP) Design badge have proven to have knowledge and skill to design an efficient heat pump system in colder climates.
4573c885-00fc-44b6-8cfd-77db3c5ec6aa.name: Cold Climate Air Source Heat Pump Design

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Explain how a heat pump works and describe their components
Describe different types of ccASHPs and explain for which type of homes they currently are best suited
Recall basic building science terminology related to ccASHPs
Explain how load calculations are used to size ccASHPs effectively and apply to examples
Discuss the importance of sizing and use a database to select equipment
Describe the considerations that need to be taken into account when adding a ccASHP to a house
Describe important points to take into account when educating the homeowner about the use of ccASHPs and their expectations
Discuss control strategies and thermostat options for ccASHPs
Discuss recommended best practices for ccASHP selection and design
Apply concepts related to ccASHP with practice examples

026a5857-f901-483d-bbfe-4542dcfe8e0b.description: Earners of this badge successfully completed the Certified Commercial Other Establishments Water Auditor (CWA) course, with the knowledge, skills, and abilities to assess the water usage and opportunities for water efficiency retrofits of commercial properties, as well as having submitted a probationary audit under the supervision of a certified CWA trainer.
026a5857-f901-483d-bbfe-4542dcfe8e0b.name: Commercial Water Auditor

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: Commercial Water Audit
alignments.description: Commercial establishments now included in training: Restaurants, Lodging, Grocery Stores, Retail, Neighborhood Centers, Galleries, Offices, Gas Stations, Car Washes, Laundromats, Dry Cleaners, Nurseries, Gyms, Salons, Pet Grooming/Boarding, Auto Repair, Car Rental, Car Sales, Self-Storage, Schools, Daycare, and Places of Worship.

badge_template_activities.title: Passed and maintained Commercial Water Auditor (CWA) certification.
Identify type of commercial establishment and know where to find benchmark data for similar establishments.

Measured water use of water fixtures in commercial establishments, including faucets, toilets, water fountains, landscape, cooling towers, pools/spas and various leaks and drips in order to calculate total water use and potential water savings opportunities.
Installed new aerators on faucets in order to reduce overall water use.
Interviewed owner/manager/site operator to determine current site specifics and water demands.
Utilized various energy and water saving appliance tracker websites in order to determine potential water-saving replacement.
Compiled comprehensive and well-informed water audit based on gathered data and research.

cb79be84-ba81-40f8-bc63-6e6cffd626af.description: Earners of the Energy Auditor Guam badge have proven to have knowledge of construction and weatherization tasks in Guam with a focus on assessing a home's building performance for energy efficiency and health and safety.
cb79be84-ba81-40f8-bc63-6e6cffd626af.name: Energy Auditor Guam

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Energy Auditor Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: Job tasks for those pursuing a career in Single-Family Energy Auditing as outlined by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

badge_template_activities.title: Identify steps in the Energy Audit Process
Explain the role of the auditor
Discuss energy auditing specific to Guam
Describe health and safety protocols you need to comply for the program
Recall basic building science principles
Describe in detail the information you need to include on the Priority List and other considerations
Evaluate a home
Enter collected data into the Audit form
Complete an Energy Audit report

3c04b3ff-8aa0-4c46-9af7-dcdbbe2aa0f6.description: Earners of the Utility Bill Adjustment for Weatherization Assistant badge have proven to have experience entering, using, and improving energy-use models whenever utility bill data is available.
3c04b3ff-8aa0-4c46-9af7-dcdbbe2aa0f6.name: Utility Bill Adjustment for Weatherization Assistant

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Energy Auditor Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: Job tasks for those pursuing a career in Single-Family Energy Auditing as outlined by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

badge_template_activities.title: Explain the importance of using utility bill adjustments to energy-use models
Input utility bill data into the Weatherization Assistant software
Analyze the results of utility bill adjustments to single-family and manufactured-housing residential energy-use models
Solve energy-use model discrepancies identified by utility bill analysis

0c2aca1d-77e7-4bb1-ad00-b87ca6ccc7ec.description: Earners of the Advanced Combustion Testing badge have proven to have knowledge and skill to complete advanced diagnostics on combustion appliances and HVAC systems.
0c2aca1d-77e7-4bb1-ad00-b87ca6ccc7ec.name: Advanced Combustion Testing

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Energy Auditor JTA
alignments.description: The National Renewable Energy Laboratory has developed the Energy Auditor Job Task Analysis to determine appropriate knowledge, skills and abilities of a professional energy auditor working in the building performance industry.

alignments.name: NREL Quality Control Inspector JTA
alignments.description: The National Renewable Energy Laboratory has developed the Quality Control Inspector Job Task Analysis to determine appropriate knowledge, skills and abilities of a quality control inspector or monitor working in the building performance industry.

badge_template_activities.title: Match combustion problems with solutions (including excessive CAZ depressurization)
Identify at least 3 causes of carbon monoxide production
List required diagnostics tests and their function/purpose
Calculate the system efficiency and CFM for gas furnaces
List causes of insufficient airflow
Match operating characteristics to specific furnace types
Compare and contrast single-stage, multi-stage and variable stage furnaces
Troubleshoot temperature rise conditions
Identify symptoms of oversized furnaces
Convert pascals to inches of water column
Calculate system input from clocking gas meters
Identify safety features and combustion-related components of gas furnaces

b81a7a17-f4ce-421a-8685-8bb58f374744.description: Earners of the ESL Career Pathways Advanced badge, who are English as a Second Language [ESL] learners, demonstrate proficiency in building a language proficiency appropriate career and educational portfolio to be used for future employment and education.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Career Pathways Advanced course.
Compose an autobiographical essay with personal and employment history.
Organize an interest inventory and finding answers to career questions.
Identify and utilize information about a job offer.
Analyze, recognize trends, and differentiate between jobs and employers.
Create, design, and edit a resume and/or curriculum vitae.
Identify and compile post-secondary certificate or degree program information.
Research a work topic and give critique, comparisons, and perspective on the topic.
Compose and deliver a professional presentation comparing ideas, evaluating outcomes, and developing a basic systems analysis.

fc4550dd-c571-4d05-bd0f-ab46c0c1d37b.description: Earners of the ESL Career Pathways Beginning badge, who are English as a Second Language [ESL] learners, demonstrate proficiency in building a language proficiency appropriate career and educational portfolio to be used for future employment and education.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Career Pathways Beginning course.
Create basic resume with contact information and work history.
Demonstrate basic proficiency in describing personal and work history.
Demonstrate ability to generate basic Career Interest Inventories.
Demonstrate basic proficiency with interpersonal communication skills.

e75ce1c4-842f-4de7-9eb7-1e641f513bb5.description: Earners of the ESL Career Pathways Intermediate badge, who are English as a Second Language [ESL] learners, demonstrate proficiency in building a language proficiency appropriate career and educational portfolio to be used for future employment and education.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Career Pathways Intermediate course.
Assemble an autobiography with personal and employment history.
Demonstrate ability to search for career values and investigate work interests.
Synthesize investigations of occupations, networking, work trends and career data.
Demonstrate understanding of time management and goal setting.
Demonstrate ability to share information, carry out telephone skills, generate correspondence, and understand workplace culture.
Demonstrate proficiency with reflecting on one's work experience and assembling a list of employability skills.
Demonstrate competence in navigating higher education: catalogs, admissions, equivalencies.
Demonstrate proficiency with public speaking, interviewing and presentation skills.
Illustrate understanding of entrepreneurship.

e10fff7e-f540-4e61-96db-db9b9cd2739d.description: Earners of the Glass - Replacement or Repair badge have proven to have the knowledge, skills, and abilities to repair or replace glass in an exterior door or window to reduce air infiltration and restore the pressure boundary.
e10fff7e-f540-4e61-96db-db9b9cd2739d.name: Glass - Replacement or Repair

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: Weatherization Crew Leader Job Task Analysis
alignments.description: In 2018, NREL's Crew Leader Scheme Committee agreed it was best practice for crew leaders to know how to do the tasks listed in the Retrofit Installer Technician (RIT) JTA before supervising RITs. Therefore, the RIT JTA has been eliminated as a stand-alone JTA, and its tasks inserted into the CL JTA.

badge_template_activities.title: Verify construction date of home to determine need for lead-safe weatherization measures
Verify glass sizing in rough opening and glass type based on installation location
Remove old glass and debris completely before beginning install or repair
Take appropriate safety precautions for working with broken glass and debris
Use three or more stops or push points to secure glass in frame and apply continuous seal around the glass

0d2bce18-9c31-4d90-b3a8-917612c7e465.description: Earners of the Microsoft Word Advanced badge demonstrate intermediate skills using Microsoft Word in a business environment completing documents like business letters, inter-office reports, contracts, memos and other business communications.
0d2bce18-9c31-4d90-b3a8-917612c7e465.name: Microsoft Word Advanced

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Microsoft Word Advanced course including up to 12 hours of training and practice.
Create documents using advanced features for a business environment.
Demonstrate using built in and custom styles feature.
Create a table of contents.
Demonstrate ability to share and edit documents using track changes, redlining and managing comments.
Demonstrate ability to create and manage columns.
Demonstrate how to use automatic and manual page breaks and section breaks.
Demonstrate working with graphs.
Demonstrate how to create and perform a mail merge including creating the data set and designing the document to be merged..

e6ab1f7d-9931-47c7-91a8-44e96663624e.description: Earners of the Mobile Home Energy Auditor badge have proven to have knowledge of mobile home construction and weatherization tasks with a focus on assessing a home's building performance for energy efficiency and health and safety.
e6ab1f7d-9931-47c7-91a8-44e96663624e.name: Mobile Home Energy Auditor

alignments.description: Job tasks for those pursuing a career in Energy Auditing as outlined by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

alignments.name: BPI Energy Auditor Certification Scheme
alignments.description: The Building Performance Institute's Energy Auditor Certification is both a standard and a requirement for those working as Energy Auditors in the weatherization industry.

badge_template_activities.title: Explain building science concepts specific to mobile homes
Describe auditing skills related to mobile homes
Discuss inspection and diagnostic skills related to mobile homes
Recall specific installation issues relevant to mobile homes
Describe health and safety issues with mobile home energy auditing and weatherization
Troubleshoot issues specific to mobile homes

616e634d-55c6-453a-a75e-528c511f4bbf.description: Earners of the PROTEC Professional Readiness and Technical Experience for Careers Internship badge have demonstrated professionalism in a work environment and proficiency in applying PROTEC skills.

Demonstrate basic proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, Google Applications and Apple Applications
Demonstrate basic proficiency with Social Media applications
Demonstrate basic proficiency with Online Communication Tools
Demonstrate basic proficiency in Online Task Management and Progress Reporting

f03297d3-73dc-4688-994d-cf2877ed211e.description: Earners of the Retrofit Installer Technician badge have proven to have knowledge of retrofit measures for improving a home's building performance for energy efficiency and health and safety.
f03297d3-73dc-4688-994d-cf2877ed211e.name: Retrofit Installer Technician - In-Person

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Standard Work Specifications
alignments.description: Created by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory, the Standard Work Specifications detail the proper installation of energy efficiency retrofits in residential single family, manufactured housing, and multifamily housing.

badge_template_activities.title: Explain the job of a Retrofit Installer Technician in weatherization
Recall the importance of clear communication
Calculate some simple math problems
Demonstrate health and safety protocols important to you and your client in the field
Recall components of windows and doors
Choose and install appropriate air sealing and insulation materials
Install simple baseload measures in a home
Demonstrate duct-sealing
Demonstrate blower door set up and basic pressure diagnostics
Explain the importance of combustion safety testing and demonstrate basic testing

d05bfb4a-ac37-4e64-a35b-8e1c4754d718.description: Earners of the Water Heater - Insulate badge have proven to have the knowledge, skills, and abilities to insulate fuel-fired and electric domestic hot water heaters and pipes to reduce water and energy loads.
d05bfb4a-ac37-4e64-a35b-8e1c4754d718.name: Water Heater - Insulate

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Fe Community College

alignments.name: NREL Standard Work Specifications
alignments.description: The Standard Work Specifications are best practice guidelines for contractors working in the energy efficiency and home performance field.

badge_template_activities.title: Identified electric versus fuel-fired domestic hot water heater

Installed insulation to cover water heater without hindering access to vital parts: draft diverter (as appropriate), temperature and pressure relief valve, thermostat or other control panel, and/or access plate

Installed pipe insulation completely and securely on first six feet of accessible inlet and outlet pipes while keeping pipe insulation at least six inches from draft diverter, as appropriate if a fuel-fired water heater
Sealed seams on water heater blanket and pipe insulation
Cleaned work area
